span.style: font-size:18; font-family:Comic Sans MS; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#550000
font-size:14; font-family:微软雅黑; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#000000

item.answer:
【考法 1】 vt. 给予权利（例如选举权）： to endow with the rights of citizenship, especially the right to vote
【例】 Slaves in US were emancipated解放 in 1863 but were not enfranchised until the Fifteenth Amendment went into effect in 1870.
【反】 disenfranchise, disempower 剥夺权利
【考法 2】 vt. 解放：to set free (as from slavery)
【例】 In a way, modern labor-saving appliances设备 enfranchised people, giving them much more leisure time.
【近】 discharge, emancipate, free, liberate, manumit, rescue, unfetter
【反】 bind, confine, enfetter 束缚；subjugate, subdue; enthrall 使臣服；使成为奴隶
【记】 France 法兰西 法国，franchise 公民权，特权，法国大革命时期著名的人和公民权利宣言→france法国与(公民)权利franchise紧紧联系着的
【另】 disfranchise
